commit_message:
Switch to using PKCS12 for TLS Term certs

*NOT* deprecating the old way of storing these, as I believe that would
create a huge mess for anyone already using it.

Change-Id: I1fee174d8b8956f3d2053781a7f18c2940b21765

commit_message:
Remove the resourceclasses CI job

All jobs are using resource classes now, this is no longer needed.

Change-Id: Ie7ad901e7aae4923af88d7efb6d1f3706ce38410
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/62/535862/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines:
- hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-resourceclasses-partition-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa from old job gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-resourceclasses-partition-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial-nv tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat > clonemap.yaml << EOF clonemap: - name: openstack-infra/devstack-gate dest: devstack-gate EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m clonemap.yaml --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack-infra/devstack-gate executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_USE_RESOURCE_CLASSES=True" EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER_ISCSI_WITH_IPA=True" # Standardize VM size for each supported ramdisk case "tinyipa" in 'tinyipa') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=384" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'tinyipa256') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=256" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'coreos') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=1280" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=coreos" ;; # if using a ramdisk without a known good value, use the devstack # default by not exporting any value for IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM esac EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-extra-vars export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="ironic" EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-vars-early # use tempest plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS+=' /opt/stack/new/ironic-tempest-plugin'" export TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY=1 EOF chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic-lib $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic-python-agent $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/python-ironicclient $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/pyghmi $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/virtualbmc $PROJECTS" export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_VIRT_DRIVER=ironic export DEVSTACK_GATE_CONFIGDRIVE=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER=pxe_ipmitool export BRANCH_OVERRIDE="{{ branch_override | default('default') }}" if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/ocata" && "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "stable/ocata" ]]; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_TLSPROXY=1 fi if [ "pxe_ipmitool" == "pxe_snmp" ] ; then # explicitly enable pxe_snmp driver export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS=fake,pxe_snmp" fi if [ "pxe_ipmitool" == "redfish" ] ; then # When deploying with redfish we need to enable the "redfish" # hardware type export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES=redfish" fi if [ "partition" == "wholedisk" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK=0" else export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE=False" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK=1" fi if [ -n "" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_BUILD_RAMDISK=1 export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_BUILD_RAMDISK=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"USE_SUBNETPOOL=False" else export DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_BUILD_RAMDISK=0 export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_BUILD_RAMDISK=False" fi if [ "bios" == "uefi" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_BOOT_MODE=uefi" fi export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT="" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_COUNT=2" # Ensure the ironic-vars-EARLY file exists touch ironic-vars-early # Pull in the EARLY variables injected by the optional builders source ironic-vars-early export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin ironic git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" # Ensure the ironic-EXTRA-vars file exists touch ironic-extra-vars # Pull in the EXTRA variables injected by the optional builders source ironic-extra-vars cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Remove state_description for trove

State description and state are always with same value, see
https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/extensions/mgmt/instances/models.py#L217-L218

Change-Id: Id86f513c329946f3816a852e478f57a5dec21779

commit_message:
Add log-tag to haproxy config file

By adding a log-tag line to the haproxy config file that contains
the network or router id, we will be able to differentiate which
proxy is logging what.  This should help with debugging.

Change-Id: I5bb57b7682c00645e20cce69847dbb3b72165aa8
Partial-bug: #1744359
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/48/535948/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log-tag %(log_tag)s # If the tag starts with "haproxy" then things should get logged # to /var/log/haproxy.log, pre-pended with this tag uuid = network_id or router_id self.log_tag = "haproxy" + "-" + METADATA_SERVICE_NAME + "-" + uuid 'log_level': self.log_level, 'log_tag': self.log_tag

subject: Get logs for short lived containers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-22 14:07:52.000000000', 'files': ['roles/collect-logs/tasks/collect.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/0641f60c48ed572f9f3367c18a2c8830a16f2ca4', 'message': 'Get logs for short lived containers

Change-Id: Ieadf93382749665b86f6b1573ff469a88b619489

commit_message:
Get logs for short lived containers

These can provide valuable information for why a deployment failed.

Change-Id: Ieadf93382749665b86f6b1573ff469a88b619489
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/97/448597/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Capture logs for short-lived containers for cont in $(docker ps -f 'status=exited' | awk {'print $NF'} | grep -v NAMES); do INFO_DIR=$BASE_DOCKER_EXTRA/containers/short-lived/${cont}; mkdir -p $INFO_DIR; INFO_FILE=$INFO_DIR/docker_info.log; echo "+ docker inspect $cont" >> $INFO_FILE; docker inspect $cont &>> $INFO_FILE; docker logs $cont &> $INFO_DIR/stdout.log; docker cp $cont:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/config.json $INFO_DIR/config.json; # NOTE(flaper87): This should go away. Services should be # using a `logs` volume docker cp $cont:/var/log $INFO_DIR/log; done;

commit_message:
Add validation for update workbook

Implement the run validation in the update_package workflow
The goal is to not start the update if the deployment is
not in a ready state.

Change-Id: Ibe12e91e848c38e1746e242844a2b45c23f90863
Depends-On: Ia33a93ebf78f9412e4c826dcdb346d78d2b143b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/61/462961/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Run validation running update update_validation: description: run some tripleo-validation playbooks input: - validation_names: [] - plan: overcloud - queue_name: tripleo tasks: notify_running: on-complete: validations action: zaqar.queue_post retry: count=5 delay=1 input: queue_name: <% $.queue_name %> messages: body: type: tripleo.package_update.v1.validations payload: validation_names: <% $.validation_names %> plan: <% $.plan %> status: RUNNING execution: <% execution() %> validations: on-success: send_message on-error: set_status_failed workflow: tripleo.package_update.v1.validations validation_name=<% $.validation %> plan=<% $.plan %> queue_name=<% $.queue_name %> with-items: validation in <% $.validation_names %> publish: status: SUCCESS set_status_failed: on-complete: send_message publish: status: FAILED send_message: action: zaqar.queue_post retry: count=5 delay=1 input: queue_name: <% $.queue_name %> messages: body: type: tripleo.package_update.v1.validations payload: validation_names: <% $.validation_names %> plan: <% $.plan %> status: <% $.get('status', 'SUCCESS') %> execution: <% execution() %> on-success: - fail: <% $.get('status') = "FAILED" %>

commit_message:
WIP: change devmode to deploy containerized services by default

** comprehensive patch **
with this change devmode will deploy containerized services in the
overcloud by default when devmode is not in gate mode.
Since gate for containerized deployments is still work in progress the
new default will not apply for gate mode. Gate mode will still deploy a
non containerized overcloud
Two options added to devmode.sh
--no-containerized-deployment to change the default for non-gate mode
--force-containerized-deployment to force containers even in gate mode
One option added to quickstart.sh
--featureset will specify the featureset

Depends-On: I1651ffb4bc01793eaea056c2f8d6fe7ba5a95f19
Change-Id: I147d2cd5713f254cedbb45b4099463c0a4b9b17c

commit_message:
Move custom_nameserver handling out of ovb

Since other non-ovb environments may also wish to use a non-google
DNS server for the undercloud, move custom_nameserver handling out
of the ovb task and into its own task.

Change-Id: I648ad7cf7eb5a15e8cbdb5f7ca7a8d31ec3f4936

commit_message:
WIP: Integrate devmode into quickstart.sh

Currently devmode.sh provides two extra function compared to
quickstart.sh:

* building and integrating changes into the deployed environment like
  gate jobs
* create environments on OVB clouds easily

This change integrates these functions back into quickstart.sh, making
it possible for developers to use the full possibilities available
through quickstart.sh. It also  extract the less central functions from
quickstart.sh into utility-functions.sh.

This change introduces --gate option that will ask the user question
about which change they want to integrate into deployed env.

The OVB function is not yet re-implemented.

Change-Id: Iaf40fab465564bc97047d71fc2001e2d65d6a773

commit_message:
Install Curator from RPM in MidoNet element

Due to some changes needed in the RDO side we refactored some code at
openstack/puppet-midonet so Elasticsearch Curator is installed from
their Yum repositories instead of it being installed with Pip.

See:
- https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1403753
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409862/
- https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/4053/

Change-Id: Ie7501ab0f6949e149b15791b9d3ba9d6370a6b00
(cherry picked from commit 164632aa195bba18612c6c1cf61791ca356a0a6a)

- Forcibly delete all br-ex configuration under

commit_message:
Rerunnable multinode CI nic config

Fixes a couple of issues with rerunning the nic config for TripleO CI
multinode environments.

- The br-ex bridge may not exist when we try to delete it, so use
  --if-exists.
- Forcibly delete all br-ex configuration under
  /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts so that os-net-config is triggered to
  recreate the config and ifdown/ifup the interface.

Change-Id: I643619cbae9cc67050a4c5a0066050b968d660ac
Closes-Bug: #1702731

commit_message:
Add no-cleanup arg for overcloud deployment

For each deploy command, the cli creates a new temporary
tripleo-heat-templates dir, with the rendered jinja files
from the swift container. The dir is dropped at the end of
the deploy command.
The --no-cleanup option keeps this temp dir after the
deployment. It's very useful for debugging purpose to keep
and to let the collect-logs role gets this dir.

Change-Id: I077918f9264fa6a3275e9d7ed5f8a96a504f910c

commit_message:
Calculate both create and update times for heat resources

Previously heat-deploy-times.py only handled CREATE* events.  Since
the update time can also be useful to look at, let's include those
numbers too.

Change-Id: I2a2b557a408b82d7f2151a4ae3aad7f1afbe663f

commit_message:
adapt neutron sanity check to containerized environment

there is a new list for container-based config files and also
update to the validation code.
the code tests if there are neutron containers. by this condition
the code will choose whether to take the baremetal paths
or the container-based paths.

Change-Id: I3c4cfbd9698fc349a8f006922a4128618506cca8

commit_message:
Use updated multi-nic configs in THT

In the depends-on patch, we move the nic configs for multi-nic
network isolation to THT. This patch changes our deploy args to
make use of them.

Change-Id: I75450641d0a3413ce01b5632dd2a26580e7be3d9
Depends-On: I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff

added_lines: - name: set network isolation args for multi-nic IPv4 (Pike+) set_fact: network_isolation_args: >- -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/ci/environments/network/multiple-nics/network-isolation-absolute.yaml -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/ci/environments/network/multiple-nics/network-environment.yaml -e {{ working_dir }}/network-environment.yaml when: - network_isolation_type == "multiple-nics" - release not in ["newton", "ocata"] - not overcloud_ipv6|bool - name: set network isolation args for multi-nic IPv4 (Ocata-) - release in ["newton", "ocata"]
deleted_lines: - name: set network isolation args for multi-nic IPv4

subject: Enable additional params for scenario/tempest ping test.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-25 15:37:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/6e24cdf02fe1f3440c1b26da3242b155b211d33c', 'message': 'Enable validation.run_validation to true

Change-Id: I7f47f499c9b0377777629635c220806da7112426
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-26 09:53:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/38f17b90fba5601414a62c429b1d183168449acc', 'message': 'Enable validation.run_validation to true in tempest.conf

tempest.api.compute.servers.test_create_server.
ServersTestBootFromVolume.test_verify_created_server_vcpus test finds
cpuinfo of the instance created by boot from volume by ssh into it. This
tests replaces the ping test. In order to run the test, we need to
enable validation.run_validation to true in tempest.conf so that tempest
tests can ssh and run the tests otherwise this test will be skipped.

Change-Id: I7f47f499c9b0377777629635c220806da7112426
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-28 12:58:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/bb5c6d091e50a8516e14d72d461edcf6d50e6e80', 'message': 'Enable validation.run_validation to true in tempest.conf

tempest.api.compute.servers.test_create_server.
ServersTestBootFromVolume.test_verify_created_server_vcpus test finds
cpuinfo of the instance created by boot from volume by ssh into it. This
tests replaces the ping test. In order to run the test, we need to
enable validation.run_validation to true in tempest.conf so that tempest

commit_message:
Enable additional params for scenario/tempest ping test.

* tempest.api.compute.servers.test_create_server.
  ServersTestBootFromVolume.test_verify_created_server_vcpus test
  finds cpuinfo of the instance created by boot from volume by ssh
  into it. This tests replaces the ping test. In order to run the
  test, we need to enable validation.run_validation to true in
  tempest.conf so that tempest tests can ssh and run the tests
  otherwise this test will be skipped.

* For running test_server_basic_ops tests we need to enable
  validation.run_validation to true as well as
  compute_feature_enabled.config_drive to true otherwise
  it will fail.

* Remove validation.ssh_user in favour validation.image_ssh_user

* Added ssh_timeout to 200 in order to perfrom ssh into the
  instance and to avoid request time out.

Change-Id: I7f47f499c9b0377777629635c220806da7112426

commit_message:
task name can not be reserved keyword

Task name can not be one of the engine commands: noop, fail, pause, succeed.

Change-Id: I4e92aba560daa3e045375a6728a7aee2b80473fc
Closes-Bug: #1705186

commit_message:
add note to not run quickstart from the ssh_user (stack)

The ssh_user is ephemeral and can be removed by quickstart.
It is not recommended or supported to use root or ssh_user (stack)

Change-Id: I8c50924f1ad9e75f25f414ad2c71d81a46f1d3f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/97/453297/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Running quickstart.sh commands as root or ssh_user(default stack) is not suggested or supported.
deleted_lines: Running quickstart.sh commands as root is not suggested or supported.

commit_message:
Post deployment installation instructions for Octavia

While Octavia services are installed, full Octavia support is
in-progress. This documentation describes general steps necessary to get
the system ready for creating load balancers.

Depends-On: If483d0ee027596999370ab0d21b1743d4ef16acb
Change-Id: I734b6a8a336d527a71bf2c5bb8bca47ba3a27bd6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/96/447496/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Deploying Octavia in the Overcloud ================================== This guide assumes that your undercloud is already installed and ready to deploy an overcloud with Octavia enabled. While deploying the Octavia services is supported in Ocata, additional steps are required before you can use Octavia LBaaS in OpenStack. Deploying the Overcloud with the Octavia Services ------------------------------------------------- To include the Octavia services in the overcloud, include the sample environment file provided. openstack overcloud deploy --templates \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/services/octavia.yaml .. note:: Octavia adds functionality to the standard Neutron deployment and should not require modification of other components. However, if you are enabling other Neutron related features you should review the octavia environment file as it may be necessary to combine values set for Neutron related parameters. Post deployment steps --------------------- Once the Octavia services are successfully running in the overcloud, the following steps need to be performed before load balancers can be created. .. note:: The names of some resources have been pre-configured in Octavia during deployment. It is important to use the same values to avoid having to update the overcloud. #. Create the load balancer network:: neutron net-create lb-mgmt-net neutron subnet-create lb-mgmt-net 192.168.199.0/24 --name lb-mgmt-subnet #. Create ports for the controllers for the load balancer network, keeping track of port ID, MAC address and IP for future use. For example:: port_id_and_mac=$($(neutron port-create --name octavia-health-manager-listen-port --binding:host_id=$(hostname) lb-mgmt-net | awk '/ id | mac_address / {print $4}') id_and_mac=($id_and_mac) MGMT_PORT_ID=${id_and_mac[0]} MGMT_PORT_MAC=${id_and_mac[1]} MGMT_PORT_IP=$(neutron port-show $MGMT_PORT_ID | awk '/ "ip_address": / {print $7; exit}' | sed -e 's/"//g' -e 's/,//g' -e 's/}//g') MGMT_PORT_DEV=o-hm1 #. On each controller, create a port on the neutron integration bridge to allow access to load balancer network:: sudo ovs-vsctl -- --may-exist add-port br-int $MGMT_PORT_DEV -- set Interface $MGMT_PORT_DEV type=internal -- set Interface $MGMT_PORT_DEV external-ids:iface-status=active -- set Interface $MGMT_PORT_DEV external-ids:attached-mac=$MGMT_PORT_MAC -- set Interface $MGMT_PORT_DEV external-ids:iface-id=$MGMT_PORT_ID -- set Interface $MGMT_PORT_DEV mac=\"$MGMT_PORT_MAC\" #. Create interface files on each controller:: cat > /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-$MGMT_PORT_DEV<<END TYPE=generic BOOTPROTO=static IPV6_AUTOCONF=no NAME=$MGMT_PORT_DEV IPADDR=$MGMT_PORT_IP NETMASK=255.255.255.0 NETWORK=192.168.199.0 BROADCAST=192.168.199.255 HWADDR=$MGMT_PORT_MAC ONBOOT=yes END ifup $MGMT_PORT_DEV #. Create security groups to for the load balancers:: neutron security-group-create lb-mgmt-sec-grp neutron security-group-rule-create --protocol icmp lb-mgmt-sec-grp neutron security-group-rule-create --protocol tcp --port-range-min 22 --port-range-max 22 lb-mgmt-sec-grp neutron security-group-rule-create --protocol tcp --port-range-min 9443 --port-range-max 9443 lb-mgmt-sec-grp #. Create SSH keys to support SSH to load balancer instances and copy to each controller:: ssh-keygen -b 2048 -t rsa -N "" -f octavia_ssh_key nova keypair-add --pub-key octavia_ssh_key scp octavia_ssh_key heat-admin@(controller-ip) scp octavia_ssh_key.pub heat-admin@(controller-ip) ssh heat-amdin@(controller-ip) sudo mv octavia_ssh_key* /etc/octavia/.ssh/ #. Create the nova flavor for the load balancer instances:: nova flavor-create --is-public False m1.amphora 65 1024 2 1 #. Upload certificates to allow secure communication with the amphorae:: TBD - generation certifications may be best left up to the deployer instead of auto-generating #. Upload the Amphora image:: (are there stock images or will the user always be expected to create the images?) Download an Amphora image for hosting the load balancer instances:: glance image-create --name octavia-amphora --disk-format qcow2 --container-format bare --file amphora-image.qcow2 Testing your setup ------------------- #. Create a load balancer using the neutron CLI on a tenant network:: neutron lbaas-loadbalancer-create --name lb my-tenant-network #. Check the load balancer details and verify that provisioning has completed (if necessary, wait for a brief period and try again):: neutron lbaas-loadbalancer-show lb #. Configure the load balancer:: neutron lbaas-pool-create --loadbalancer lb --protocol HTTP --protocol-port 80 --name listener-pool neutron lbaas-member-create --subnet my-tenant-network --address 192.168.70.4 --protocol-port 80 listener-pool

commit_message:
Adding scenarios tests in default regex

Adding these tests in the regex, will remove the gab between what
tripleo test and what OSP QE test.
Also, we can avoid much more issues running scenarios on experimental
job.

Change-Id: Idfedc075c2475f88493ed449067dbf161d489e0c

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

tripleo-common already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
	setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ia705ae7092dbcbb669768460bf2ff909ce612605

revisions:

Two new parameters are added:

custom_yaml is an array, containing the list of the custom yamls that

commit_message:
Add the ability to load custom yaml(s)

This commit adds the ability for a user to load custom yaml from the
working directory to the undercloud and to automatically add this (or
these) new yaml to the deploy command line.
Two new parameters are added:

custom_yaml: []
custom_yaml_args: ""

custom_yaml is an array, containing the list of the custom yamls that
must exist locally, like:

custom_yaml:
  - storage-custom.yaml
  - other-custom.yaml

custom_yaml_args gets added at the end of the deploy command line and is
automatically populated by the pre-deploy task.

Change-Id: I636915bc5e11d9f61067116fbec43b5486899bb1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/02/500602/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # List of custom yaml files to be added at the end of the deploy command line, # like: # # custom_yaml: # - storage-custom.yaml # # This will be added at the end of the deploy command line, after extra_args custom_yaml: [] # custom_yaml_args variable will be populated automatiocally based upon the # content of extra_yaml custom_yaml_args: "" {{ custom_yaml_args }}

commit_message:
bagpipe v2 driver

The behavior of the current "v1" bagpipe driver is to
produce both the old and new RPCs to not prevent rolling
upgrades.

This change introduces a bagpipe v2 driver that does not
produce old RPCs and only relies on OVO push/pull RPCs.

To avoid code duplication of the code for new RPCs,
the current driver is refactored to inherits from the
v2 driver the code for the new OVO push/pull RPCs.

The current v1 driver is also modified to raise a warning
indicating its future removal.

This change also extends the previous unit test
coverage for the production of push-based RPCs.

Change-Id: I708ec1e4d8a8c27ffe8c4be172812e0a9aed54b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/43/533143/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.service_drivers.bagpipe \ import bagpipe_v2 as v2 class BaGPipeBGPVPNDriver(v2.BaGPipeBGPVPNDriver): def update_bgpvpn_postcommit(self, context, old_bgpvpn, bgpvpn): super(BaGPipeBGPVPNDriver, self).update_bgpvpn_postcommit( context, old_bgpvpn, bgpvpn) super(BaGPipeBGPVPNDriver, self).create_net_assoc_postcommit(context, net_assoc) if v2.network_is_external(context, port['network_id']): super(BaGPipeBGPVPNDriver, self).create_router_assoc_postcommit() super(BaGPipeBGPVPNDriver, self).notify_router_interface_created( context, router_id, net_id) super(BaGPipeBGPVPNDriver, self).notify_router_interface_deleted( context, router_id, net_id)
deleted_lines: from neutron.api.rpc.callbacks import events as rpc_events from neutron.api.rpc.callbacks.producer import registry as pull_registry from neutron.api.rpc.handlers import resources_rpc from neutron.db.models import external_netfrom neutron_lib import exceptions as n_excfrom networking_bgpvpn.neutron.extensions import bgpvpn as bgpvpn_extfrom networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.service_drivers import driver_apiBAGPIPE_DRIVER_NAME = "bagpipe" class BGPVPNExternalNetAssociation(n_exc.NeutronException): message = _("driver does not support associating an external" "network to a BGPVPN") def network_is_external(context, net_id): try: context.session.query(external_net.ExternalNetwork).filter_by( network_id=net_id).one() return True except orm.exc.NoResultFound: return False def _get_associations(resource, network_id, **kwargs): context = kwargs.get('context') if context is None: LOG.warning( 'Received pull for %(resource)s %(network_id)s without context', {'resource': resource, 'network_id': network_id}) return return bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNAssociations.get_objects(context, network_id=network_id) class BaGPipeBGPVPNDriver(driver_api.BGPVPNDriver): registry.subscribe(self.registry_router_interface_created, resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, events.AFTER_CREATE) registry.subscribe(self.registry_router_interface_deleted, resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, events.AFTER_DELETE) self.setup_rpc() def _push_association(self, context, association, event_type): self._push_associations(context, [association], event_type) def _push_associations(self, context, associations, event_type): for assoc in associations: LOG.debug("pushing %s %s (%s)", event_type, assoc, assoc.bgpvpn) self._push_rpc.push(context, associations, event_type) def _common_precommit_checks(self, bgpvpn): # No support yet for specifying route distinguishers if bgpvpn.get('route_distinguishers', None): raise bgpvpn_ext.BGPVPNRDNotSupported(driver=BAGPIPE_DRIVER_NAME) def create_bgpvpn_precommit(self, context, bgpvpn): self._common_precommit_checks(bgpvpn) def _push_bgpvpn_associations(self, context, bgpvpn_id, event_type): self._push_associations( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNNetAssociation.get_objects( context, bgpvpn_id=bgpvpn_id), event_type) self._push_associations( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNRouterAssociation.get_objects( context, bgpvpn_id=bgpvpn_id), event_type) def delete_bgpvpn_precommit(self, context, bgpvpn): self._push_bgpvpn_associations(context, bgpvpn['id'], rpc_events.DELETED) def update_bgpvpn_precommit(self, context, old_bgpvpn, bgpvpn): self._common_precommit_checks(bgpvpn) def update_bgpvpn_postcommit(self, context, old_bgpvpn, bgpvpn): self._push_bgpvpn_associations(context, bgpvpn['id'], rpc_events.UPDATED) def create_net_assoc_precommit(self, context, net_assoc): if network_is_external(context, net_assoc['network_id']): raise BGPVPNExternalNetAssociation() self._push_association( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNNetAssociation.get_object( context, id=net_assoc['id']), rpc_events.CREATED) def delete_net_assoc_precommit(self, context, net_assoc): self._push_association( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNNetAssociation.get_object( context, id=net_assoc['id']), rpc_events.DELETED) if network_is_external(context, port['network_id']): self._push_association( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNRouterAssociation.get_object( context, id=router_assoc['id']), rpc_events.CREATED) def delete_router_assoc_precommit(self, context, router_assoc): self._push_association( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNRouterAssociation.get_object( context, id=router_assoc['id']), rpc_events.DELETED) # update associations: # - for the networks on which the router was plugged # - for the plugged router self._push_associations( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNNetAssociation.get_objects( context, network_id=net_id), rpc_events.UPDATED) self._push_associations( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNRouterAssociation.get_objects( context, id=router_id), rpc_events.UPDATED) # update associations: # - for the networks on which the router was plugged # - for the plugged router self._push_associations( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNNetAssociation.get_objects( context, network_id=net_id), rpc_events.UPDATED) self._push_associations( context, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNRouterAssociation.get_objects( context, id=router_id), rpc_events.UPDATED) @log_helpers.log_method_call def registry_router_interface_created(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): try: context = kwargs['context'] router_id = kwargs['router_id'] net_id = kwargs['port']['network_id'] self.notify_router_interface_created(context, router_id, net_id) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e) @log_helpers.log_method_call def registry_router_interface_deleted(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): try: context = kwargs['context'] # for router_interface after_delete, in stable/newton, the # callback does not include the router_id directly, but we find # it in the port device_id router_id = kwargs['port']['device_id'] net_id = kwargs['port']['network_id'] self.notify_router_interface_deleted(context, router_id, net_id) except Exception as e: _log_callback_processing_exception(resource, event, trigger, kwargs, e) def setup_rpc(self): self._push_rpc = resources_rpc.ResourcesPushRpcApi() pull_registry.provide(_get_associations, bgpvpn_objects.BGPVPNAssociations.obj_name())

commit_message:
WIP: Revert "Set jobs subunit file as fail until it's overwritten"

Currently openstack-health is 100% failing for container jobs, since
they don't seem to run pingtest.

This reverts commit cd6beb60f56cafdf51872c98277b4a01e0ffb7d0.

Change-Id: Icf1c73cd80856dcbb2a2e40184009bf58e717165
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Run non-controller upgrade with ansible

Instead of running the non controller upgrade
script directly via ssh, this review aims to
run it with mistral-ansible workflow

Change-Id: Ie0e80ac6556b83e8f5521bc23b39ea9a97af7edb

Remove hardcoded overcloud_release value

The hardcoded overcloud_release param force the
composable_upgrade.yml config file to use newton
overcloud release for the mixed deployment

commit_message:
Add check on download_overcloud_templates_rpm to trigger custom-tht

The custom-tht is trigger only when:
overcloud_templates_repo is defined and overcloud_templates_refspec
or overcloud_templates_branch
So it skip the mixed deployment when we want to get the tht rpm
outside of the undercloud repo to deploy the overcloud with it
Adding the download_overcloud_templates_rpm with a logical or

Change-Id: Ie85d96afce305ff5adc88990d090bb05caa362ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/12/479212/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: - overcloud_templates_refspec is defined or overcloud_templates_branch is defined

commit_message:
Use sub_nodes_private

Use the private interfaces of test envs rather than public. This avoids
using NAT and is the piece we have compatible files in place for zuulv3

Added formatters=sorted(prop.keys()) as suggested by the reviewer, to avoid tying server
knowledge to the client and also any update on the server side would easily reflect here.
*Fixed pep8 issues

Closes-bug: #1680444
Change-Id: Ie38236db364d59ddab42cb925d0435777b0ffe86

commit_message:
Removes unicode 'u' response for "cinder get-capabilities"

The output of "cinder get-capabilities" command returns
unicoded response. But it would appear from the utils
class that setting formatters will go through the
capabilities dict and make sure all values are properly
string formatted. Therefore added formatters to return
string formatted response.

Added formatters=sorted(prop.keys()) line instead of
static values as suggested by the reviewer, to avoid
tying server knowledge to the client and also any
update on the server side would easily reflect here.

Closes-bug: #1680444
Change-Id: Ie38236db364d59ddab42cb925d0435777b0ffe86

commit_message:
show values at -eol tags as well as on branches

Sometimes we want to go further back in history than the current open
branches, so include the -eol tags as well.

Change-Id: Idb7ca9d0f4dd2f7dc6701577cc495a8010ee1340
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
blueprint tripleo-predictable-ctlplane-ips

Spec: User-specifiable Control Plane IP on Routed Isolated Networks

This spec describes the features required for selecting a specific IP
to use for the Control Plane IP on each node in a TripleO deployment.
The implementation will involve adding parameters for the subnet and
fixed_ip of the Control Plane, along with examples and documentation.

CI will need to be updated to test this feature when it merges.

This is a dependency of blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

Change-Id: I548a5592486d49c17f4cdb29ec41537b4f406b9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/10/421010/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================================================== User-specifiable Control Plane IP for TripleO Routed Isolated Networks ====================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/tripleo-predictable-ctlplane-ips This spec describes the changes required to allow the Control Plane IP to be specified prior to deploying with TripleO. In a routed network environment, it may be desired to have specific control over which nodes receive which IP addresses according to their geographic location. Eventually this may be possible using location awareness in Ironic and Neutron, but those features are still in the design phase. Problem Description =================== Predictable placement of the control plane IP addresses is currently not possible. Each member of a role is an OS::Nova::Server resource, and we only pass the network ("ctlplane") to the resource. This causes a random IP address to be chosen from the AllocationPool associated with the subnet. Because of this, there is no way to pass a specific IP to a role member for the Control Plane IP, even though all other IPs may be specified. In order to allow for the Control Plane IP to be specified, we will need to pass a FixedIP parameter to the OS::Nova::Server. In order to provide flexibility for developing spine-and-leaf topology on top of the control plane, we will also need to allow for passing a subnet rather than a network for automatic IP selection. Proposed Change =============== Overview -------- The role definitions in tripleo-heat-templates/puppet/*-role.yaml will be modified. Currently the Control Plane IP is created in the role definition:: resources: Controller: type: OS::TripleO::Server metadata: os-collect-config: command: {get_param: ConfigCommand} properties: image: {get_param: controllerImage} image_update_policy: {get_param: ImageUpdatePolicy} flavor: {get_param: OvercloudControlFlavor} key_name: {get_param: KeyName} networks: - network: ctlplane Because only the network name is passed, there is no way to influence the IP which is chosen for the instance. We will need to modify this to pass the parameters needed to select the IP address. Alternatives ------------ There are other ways that we could set the Control Plane IP address. We could pass an IP address to the os-net-config template, and it will configure it. This could be done through Puppet, or a new Heat resource, or a script. However, this would mean that the Neutron port database was out of sync with the actual IP addresses in use. In the implementation of this spec, there are several alternative approaches which would fulfill the requirements: * Create a Neutron port prior to creating the OS::TripleO::Server resource, and pass the ID of the port to the Server resource instead of the network. * Pass a subnet rather than a network, so that an IP address is chosen from the correct subnet. * Pass a network, subnet, and fixed_ip parameter (any of which may be null). The first approach is not backwards-compatible. The second approach will allow IPs on a user-selectable subnet but won't allow a specific IP. The third approach will select the specific IP if fixed_ip is passed, or will select the IP from the subnet if passed, and if those values are both null, the network parameter will be used (current behavior). Security Impact --------------- The isolated networking model is based on separation of control and data planes, as well as separation of traffic by function. Providing a means to influence the IP address, routes, and subnet where hosts are located introduces the possibility of a configuration error opening up parts of the deployment to unwanted traffic or attacks. There is no security impact expected to the OpenStack deployment itself as a result of refactoring the role Control Plane IP address, but there are security implications in the alternate network topologies that will use these new features features. In the traditional isolated networks model, most of the networks are isolated subnets, and the hosts have no router associated with the subnet (with the exception of a single routable network). When an installer configures IPs and routes for multiple subnets, the security perimiter is moved up into the network fabric. Therefore, certain best practices should be maintained in the underlying network configuration. Other End User Impact --------------------- This change will result in some minor changes to existing environment templates in tripleo-heat-templates/environments, as well as result in one or more new environment files. Performance Impact ------------------ No performance impacts are expected from this change. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- When upgrading from a previous version of OpenStack TripleO, the environment files specifying IP addresses for nodes will have to be updated to follow the new model. Developer Impact ---------------- This change is a prerequisite for much of the development of spine-and-leaf, since it provides a way to boot nodes in multiple subnets. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: dsneddon@redhat.com Other contributors: TBD (NOTE: co-developers welcome --@dsneddon) Work Items ---------- * Refactor the role definitions in tripleo-heat-templates/puppet to allow for passing a subnet and/or fixed_ip. * Refactor the ips-from-pool-all.yaml to include definitions for the ctlplane. * Create a new environment file for setting the ctlplane IP without specifying other IP addresses. * Modify at least one CI job to test functionality of setting IP addresses on the Control Plane network. Dependencies ============ Implementation of this spec is a dependency of the tripleo-routed-networks- deployment blueprint. This spec does not depend on any other specs. Testing ======= This feature should be tested in CI by modifying at least one CI job to use pre-selected IP addresses for the Control Plane. As additional spine-and-leaf features are implemented, we will want to use this feature to test routed networks in CI. Documentation Impact ==================== We will need to modify the tripleo-docs to relect the changes. Also, the environment files serve to document the use of the feature, so they should be well commented and give concrete examples of usage. When spine-and-leaf is implemented, we will want to make sure we have fully documented how to configure subnetting, routing, and firewalling to ensure that the result is secure. References ========== The overall Blueprint for Spine and Leaf is located here: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

subject: Make create_server tests more policy-granular
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-13 23:27:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/cc826612c69705bc846fe5cae59eb1c41e133f8b', 'message': "Make create_test_server in Patrole more policy granular

This PS adds a classmethod helper to Patrole's compute rbac_base
module to make create_test_server more policy granular.

This helper method is useful for avoiding extra policy actions being
enforced when calling ``self.create_test_server.`` To accomplish this,
do:

    with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self):
        server = self.create_test_server()  # wait_until is None.
    self.wait_for_server_status(server, status='ACTIVE')

Note that this should only be used in cases where
``self.create_test_server`` is called within the above contextmanager.

This PS makes necessary changes to tests that use wait_until='ACTIVE'
inside the override_role contextmanager.

Note that further refactoring for edge cases like creating a validatable
server is not required because Patrole doesn't currently have relevant
test scenarios that need it.

However, work still needs to be done to make volume-backed server
creatiom atomic, which currently involves creating a volume and
waiting for it to become active within the same contextmanager scope.

commit_message:
Make create_server tests more policy-granular

This PS makes the tests in test_create_serve rmore policy-granular
by removing create_test_server from the ``override_role`` contextmanager
blocks because the function can call many different policies.

Change-Id: I299db38b1ab8f5233de44643aca052b9c34bb7ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/75/533375/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import excutils from tempest.common import waitersLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @classmethod def wait_for_server_status(cls, servers, status=None): """Helper method to wait for servers to reach desired status. This helper method is useful for avoiding extra policy actions being enforced when calling ``self.create_test_server.`` To accomplish this, do:: with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): server = self.create_test_server() # wait_until is None. self.wait_for_server_status(server, status='ACTIVE') Note that this should only be used in cases where ``self.create_test_server`` is called within the above contextmanager. :param list servers: List of servers to wait on until status is reached. :param str status: Server status to wait for the server to reach after its creation. """ if not isinstance(servers, list): servers = [servers] for server in servers: try: waiters.wait_for_server_status( cls.servers_client, server['id'], status) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): for server in servers: try: cls.servers_client.delete_server(server['id']) except Exception: LOG.exception('Deleting server %s failed', server['id']) for server in servers: # NOTE(artom) If the servers were booted with volumes # and with delete_on_termination=False we need to wait # for the servers to go away before proceeding with # cleanup, otherwise we'll attempt to delete the # volumes while they're still attached to servers that # are in the process of being deleted. try: waiters.wait_for_server_termination( cls.servers_client, server['id']) except Exception: LOG.exception('Server %s failed to delete in time', server['id'])

commit_message:
change the kill mode for vitrage-graph service

since vitrage graph creates child processes we
want to kill the children processes if systemd cannot
stop the service

Change-Id: I93a5d680fe93b929f9bc83489d7edb636205846d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/71/536771/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

* Zesty is EOL

Change-Id: Ica7b86e46a483a8602d6b0c4250957ae17346ece
"}]
commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

* Zesty is EOL

Change-Id: Ica7b86e46a483a8602d6b0c4250957ae17346ece
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder-backup refs/changes/78/536478/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: get_relation_ip, def __init__(self, singlenode_mode=False, address_types=ADDRESS_TYPES): self.address_types = address_types for addr_type in self.address_types: # NOTE(thedac) For some reason the ADDRESS_MAP uses 'int' rather # than 'internal' if addr_type == 'internal': _addr_map_type = INTERNAL else: _addr_map_type = addr_type # Network spaces aware laddr = get_relation_ip(ADDRESS_MAP[_addr_map_type]['binding'], config(cfg_opt)) # API Charms will need to set {addr_type}-address with # get_relation_ip(addr_type) # NOTE(jamespage) add backend based on get_relation_ip - this # will either be the only backend or the fallback if no acls # Network spaces aware addr = get_relation_ip('cluster') # API Charms will need to set their private-address with # get_relation_ip('cluster')
deleted_lines: get_host_ip, def __init__(self, singlenode_mode=False): if config('prefer-ipv6'): addr = get_ipv6_addr(exc_list=[config('vip')])[0] else: addr = get_host_ip(unit_get('private-address')) for addr_type in ADDRESS_TYPES: laddr = get_address_in_network(config(cfg_opt)) # NOTE(jamespage) add backend based on private address - this # with either be the only backend or the fallback if no acls

subject: Integration of (Distributed) Port Binding OVO

commit_message:
Integration of (Distributed) Port Binding OVO

This patch integrates Port Binding OVO in /plugins/ml2/db.py
and /plugins/ml2/plugin.py.

Co-Authored-By: Artur Korzeniewski <artur.korzeniewski@intel.com>
Change-Id: Idb76c0cb2a4d66690c9aca5ba338d5df814cd21e
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/68/407868/82 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: binding = db.add_port_binding(context, result['id']) port_host = db.get_port_binding_host(context, port_id)
deleted_lines: binding = db.add_port_binding(session, result['id']) port_host = db.get_port_binding_host(context.session, port_id)

commit_message:
enable ovn metadata in computenode conf sample

This patch enables networking-ovn-metadata-agent service in
devstack/computenode-local.conf.sample.
It should be recommanded to enable metadata agent for supporting
nova metadata api by default.

Change-Id: Iaea7cbe7683cfcf8ce3000a1715bc86eda2347c9
Closes-Bug: 1743536

added_lines: --- features: - New CLI commands were added - template add and template delete. Templates can now be added/removed by CLI commands while vitrage is running (no restart is required). Templates are stored in database and remain after restarting vitrage. Adding/removing a template at runtime preforms a live update to the entity graph.

commit_message:
Remove inner_exceptions plumbing

We've finally gotten out of the business of wrapping exceptions. Since
we don't do that anymore, we don't need the log_inner_exceptions logic.

Change-Id: Id1f709daa2e61c13efeeeffc2a08578c27265e56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/40/536640/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :param bool log_inner_exceptions: Ignored. Exists for backwards compat.
deleted_lines: :param bool log_inner_exceptions: Send wrapped exceptions to the error log. Defaults to false, because there are a number of wrapped exceptions that are noise for normal usage. It's possible that for a user that has python logging configured properly, it's desirable to have all of the wrapped exceptions be emitted to the error log. This flag will enable that behavior. if log_inner_exceptions: OpenStackCloudException.log_inner_exceptions = True

Switch to neutron-tempest-plugin for tempest tests

* https://review.openstack.org/519310 syncs the code from neutron
  project to neutron-tempest-plugin repo and it is better to depend
  on new one inorder to avoid the breakage.

Change-Id: Icf3ec7c186f45e86d602d5bc8754b91ddab47732
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/41/521341/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_tempest_plugin.api import base from neutron_tempest_plugin import config
deleted_lines: from neutron.tests.tempest.api import base from neutron.tests.tempest import config

commit_message:
Add doc8 to pep8 check for glance project

This patch adds a doc8 check of .rst files to the current pep8 check.
It includes fixes to the .rst files that didn't pass the check.

Co-authored-By: Hoang Trung Hieu <hieuht@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I5a9299200202576d97760ebf07bceb930888f2d7

added_lines: doc8 README.rst releasenotes/source doc/source rally-jobs CONTRIBUTING.rst --ignore D001

commit_message:
Updating for new sphinx docs jobs

There have been recent changes to how docs jobs are run under zuul [1].
This patch updates neutron-lbaas-dashboard to be able to run under the
new zuul docs jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508694/

Change-Id: I482b4904838f39e7e32eb499ef9a29a4ec349522

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: I74575c6c6796f875bd4b5b36ced1563c46fb2e47

commit_message:
Add networking-generic-switch-tempest-plugin under ironic

commit_message:
Add tempest-stress in Quality Assurance

tempest-stress is to perform stress testing of cloud using tempest.
This framework used to be in tempest earlier but due to tempest scope
it had been moved out of tempest tree. During queens PTG (even earlier)
we discussed to make it in separate repo.

Depends-On: I063303642f5c99e4ca95d0e02c2360a003688ad6
Change-Id: Ib6fb2eac8568f6e86aae24782bfa6d9cca4fe54c

commit_message:
Stop abusing [keystone_authtoken]

That config section should be private for keystonemiddleware, so deprecate and
discourage its use for trusts creation.

Create a new config section for credentials to create trusts with.

Change-Id: I93b9a9b4c8003463c33439f116b9a72619512b98

deleted_lines: keystone_authtoken project_name $SERVICE_TENANT_NAME iniset $SAHARA_CONF_FILE keystone_authtoken username sahara keystone_authtoken password $SERVICE_PASSWORD keystone_authtoken user_domain_name "$SERVICE_DOMAIN_NAME" keystone_authtoken project_domain_name "$SERVICE_DOMAIN_NAME"

commit_message:
Optimise the code for log directory created

Change-Id: Icfab4d3e916c570b2887944cfc7a907f8991bfe2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/78/536678/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: file_name = '/var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log' try: log_file = prepare_logging(file_name) except IOError: pass try: log_file = prepare_logging() except (OSError, IOError) as err_msg: # This avoids freezer-agent to crash if it can't write to # ~/.freezer, which may happen on some env (for me, # it happens in Jenkins, as freezer-agent can't write to # /var/lib/jenkins). print(encodeutils.safe_decode('{}'.format(err_msg)), file=sys.stderr)
deleted_lines: for file_name in ['/var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log', '/var/log/freezer.log']: try: log_file = prepare_logging(file_name) except IOError: pass work_dir = os.path.join(home, '.freezer') if not os.path.exists(work_dir): try: os.makedirs(work_dir) log_file = prepare_logging(os.path.join(work_dir, 'freezer.log')) except (OSError, IOError) as err_msg: # This avoids freezer-agent to crash if it can't write to # ~/.freezer, which may happen on some env (for me, # it happens in Jenkins, as freezer-agent can't write to # /var/lib/jenkins). print(encodeutils.safe_decode('{}'.format(err_msg)), file=sys.stderr)

subject: Render deprecated policy names when generating files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-10 22:56:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/3d63d5d0b6d3555ac08c1c6337b1f2b7f90972d4', 'message': "WIP: Render deprecated policy names when generating files

We found out the when policy files are generated they don't have
deprecated policies. This can be problematic for services that use
rendered policy files because they could still be using the
deprecated policy name and not the new policy name.

This commit makes sure we render the deprecated policy name
with the current policy check string if the policy is deprecated.
This makes it so that operators don't have to change two policies
if they override a deprecated policy.

Change-Id: Iaf0c89a035775770ceaa230c65ce8eb195b9d82b
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-10 23:10:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/825d80ec3020de15f8ca6fcd25570db785712531', 'message': "WIP: Render deprecated policy names when generating files

We found out the when policy files are generated they don't have
deprecated policies. This can be problematic for services that use
rendered policy files because they could still be using the
deprecated policy name and not the new policy name.

This commit makes sure we render the deprecated policy name
as an alias to the new policy name. This makes it so that operators
don't have to change two policies if they override a deprecated
policy.

Change-Id: Iaf0c89a035775770ceaa230c65ce8eb195b9d82b
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-16 22:00:34.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/tests/test_generator.py', 'oslo_policy/generator.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/2ae04ebdef1bea1cb3ffbca6d04084a417ade99b', 'message': "Render deprecated policy names when generating files

We found out the when policy files are generated they don't have
deprecated policies. This can be problematic for services that use
rendered policy files because they could still be using the
deprecated policy name and not the new policy name.

This commit makes sure we render the deprecated policy name
as an alias to the new policy name. This makes it so that operators
don't have to change two policies if they override a deprecated
policy.

Closes-Bug: 1742569

Change-Id: Iaf0c89a035775770ceaa230c65ce8eb195b9d82b
"}]
commit_message:
Render deprecated policy names when generating files

We found out the when policy files are generated they don't have
deprecated policies. This can be problematic for services that use
rendered policy files because they could still be using the
deprecated policy name and not the new policy name.

This commit makes sure we render the deprecated policy name
as an alias to the new policy name. This makes it so that operators
don't have to change two policies if they override a deprecated
policy.

Closes-Bug: 1742569

Change-Id: Iaf0c89a035775770ceaa230c65ce8eb195b9d82b

%(text)s
' '"%(old_name)s": "%(check_str)s"'
